intro: Kunzea corifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved kunzea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Kunzea corifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
